success.statement: Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
success.author: Winston S. Churchill

success.statement: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
success.author: Herman Melville

success.statement: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
success.author: Colin R. Davis

success.statement: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
success.author: Henry David Thoreau

success.statement: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
success.author: Chris Grosser

love.statement: I swear I couldn’t love you more than I do right now, and yet I know I will tomorrow
love.author: Leo Christopher

love.statement: 'I love you' begins by I, but it ends up by you.
love.author: Charles de Leusse

love.statement: There is a madness in loving you, a lack of reason that makes it feel so flawless
love.author: Leo Christopher

love.statement: You are the last thought in my mind before I drift off to sleep and the first thought when I wake up each morning
love.author: Unknown

love.statement: You know it’s love when all you want is that person to be happy, even if you’re not part of their happiness
love.author: Julia Roberts

money.statement: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest
money.author: Benjamin Franklin

money.statement: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work
money.author: Thomas Edison

money.statement: Money never made a man happy yet, nor will it. The more a man has, the more he wants. Instead of filling a vacuum, it makes one
money.author: Benjamin Franklin

money.statement: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
money.author: Jim Rohn

programming.statement: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
programming.author: Chris Pine

programming.statement: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
programming.author: Dennis Ritchie

programming.statement: Sometimes it's better to leave something alone, to pause, and that's very true of programming.
programming.author: Joyce Wheeler

programming.statement: In some ways, programming is like painting. You start with a blank canvas and certain basic raw materials. You use a combination of science, art, and craft to determine what to do with them
programming.author: Andrew Hunt

programming.statement: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding
programming.author: Burt Rutan
